title: Shia LaBeouf joins Vanessa Kirby in new drama film Pieces of a Woman
text:
Just weeks before his new film Honey Boy hits theaters, Shia LaBeouf has set up a new film project.

The 33 year old actor and writer has signed on to star in Pieces of a Woman alongside British actress Vanessa Kirby, according to The Hollywood Reporter.

Production is scheduled to begin on the film this coming December in Montreal, though no release plans have been given.

New project: Just weeks before his new film Honey Boy hits theaters, Shia LaBeouf has set up a new film project

The Pieces of a Woman story follows a home birth that turns tragic, as the grieving woman tries to come to terms with her loss.

She must also deal with the ramifications of her terrible loss with her husband, while also dealing with her estranged mother.

While no roles were specified, Kirby will most likely play the grieving mother and LaBeouf the husband, though those roles haven't been confirmed.

Story: The Pieces of a Woman story follows a home birth that turns tragic, as the grieving woman tries to come to terms with her loss

Kornél Mundruczó (White God) is attached to direct Pieces of a Woman from a script by Kata Weber, who wrote White God and Mundruczo's 2017 film Jupiter's Moon.

Kevin Turen and Ashley Levinson will produce for Little Lamb Studios, a division of Bron Studios that produced the hit HBO show Euphoria, with Arrival producer Aaron Ryder.

Bron's Aaron L. Gilbert and Euphoria creator Sam Levinson will executive produce with Viktória Petrányi, Jason Cloth and Stuart Manashil.

Recent films: Both LaBeouf and Kirby are coming off recent films, with LaBeouf starring in The Peanut Butter Falcon and Kirby in Hobbs and Show, which both debuted in August

Both LaBeouf and Kirby are coming off recent films, with LaBeouf starring in The Peanut Butter Falcon and Kirby in Hobbs and Show, which both debuted in August.

LaBeouf also stars in the upcoming drama Honey Boy, which he also wrote the screenplay for based on his own relationship with his father, in theaters November 8.

Kirby will next be seen in Mr. Jones, alongside Peter Sarsgaard, which is currently hitting the festival circuit and doesn't have a release date yet.

Coming soon: Kirby will next be seen in Mr. Jones, alongside Peter Sarsgaard, which is currently hitting the festival circuit and doesn't have a release date yet

LaBeouf also stars in The Tax Collector, which is currently in post-production, where he stars alongside George Lopez and Lana Parilla.

The Tax Collector also reunites LaBeouf with writer-director David Fury, who directed LaBeouf in the 2014 World War II film Fury.

Kirby also stars in The World To Come with Katherine Waterston and Casey Affleck and an untitled project from filmmaker Adam Leon.
